content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Learn how to create a sticky image with CSS.
Sticky Image

Note:
This example does not work in Internet Explorer or Edge 15 and earlier versions.
Sticky Image
Example
img.sticky {
position: sticky;
top: 0;
}

An element with
position: sticky;
is positioned based on the user's scroll position.
A sticky element toggles between
relative
and
fixed
, depending on the scroll position. It is positioned relative until a given offset position is met in the viewport - then it "sticks" in place (like position:fixed).
Note:
You must specify at least one of
top
,
right
,
bottom
or
left
for 
sticky positioning to work.
To learn more about CSS positoning, read our
CSS Position
tutorial.
To learn more about how to style images, read our
CSS Images
tutorial.
